metadata.title: CVE-2022-4144 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read flaw was found in the QXL display device emulation inQEMU. The qxl_phys2virt() function does not check the size of the structurepointed to by the guest physical address, potentially reading past the endof the bar space into adjacent pages. A malicious guest user could use thisflaw to crash the QEMU process on the host causing a denial of servicecondition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-kvm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-aarch64 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-common - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-user - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-user-static - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
qemu-utils - 1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.51+esm2').
